commitmsg: Added an alert message telling the user to update their add-on if they click the reset button but the add-on doesn't support it.
Added a 'reset graph' button.
added sid's suggested privacy policy.
visually distinguished instructions on the collusion page so it's easier to tell if you're in demo mode or not.
display a message on the collusion page if addon installation is detected while in demo mode.
window.resetGraph() is now exposed to collusion pages, which resets the state of the collusion graph.
the add-on now attaches the page mod to any existing collusion tabs when installed/enabled.
renamed force-content-script.js to index-content-script.js.
Changed version to 0.10.
Added instructions for use in the add-on description.
changed version to 0.9.
Fixed issue 7, 'Cull out toolness.org from Collusion graph'.
Fixed issue 17, 'Exceptions thrown when serving pages from 127.0.0.1'.
Added tri-license.
Added a byline thingy.
changed version to 0.8.

When the addon is installed (i.e. when the page isn't in demo mode), the page is now sized to be the full width of the browser window, rather than just 640 pixels wide. The height of the SVG canvas is also set to be the height of the full page in this case. The page/svg doesn't resize itself when the browser window is dynamically resized, though, so the user currently needs to reload the page manually themselves.

Also, when the page is reloaded and the addon is installed, the collusion graph properly displays itself.
enclose page contents in a #page div which specifies width; .info div is positioned absolutely to be at the top-right of #page, rather than being hard-coded to assume a width of 640px.
Change version to 0.7.
Fix bug when NS_ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_DOMAIN_LEVELS is thrown on hosts like 'localhost'.

Merge pull request #4 from clarkbw/master

Use nsIEffectiveTLDService instead of a hilariously bad approximation that fails with .co.uk, etc.
use the nsIEffectiveTLDService to find the domain name
changed version to 0.6. No actual change in addon code, but using latest addon sdk.
fixed annoying typo that broke the addon
added links to blog post, github repo
Changed version to 0.4.
use collusion.toolness.org as base url, and pull base url list from comma-separated collusion.urls pref if possible.
minor code formatting changes
renamed w,h to SVG_WIDTH,SVG_HEIGHT
made the demo look nicer on iOS.
fixed a bug in the new demo code
the demo is much higher fidelity now, as it shows the collusion graph building in real-time.
add timestamp information to log
less jarring domain info overlay, as the overlays are now cached in the DOM and images don't constantly have to be reloaded.
removed a sentence from the first tutorial page b/c it was way too long.
Changed tutorial copy based on feedback.
Changed add-on description.
changed url to point to github project page.
renamed force.html to index.html.
added readme
show info overlay on right side of svg instead of right corner of viewable area
set pointer-events: none for all text content except links, so it's easier to use the graph through them
set base target to _blank.
mentioned the filter bubble in a different step
keep all hidden things hidden earlier
changed dimensions of svg to 640x480.
made the demo a lot more scripted.
set link color of domains to be the same as their node color.
minor wording change
use CSS classes to determine color of nodes, instead of directly applying fill color
factored out new functions, showLiveBrowserData() and showDemo().
hide info on page load, instead of after json is loaded
show favicons and tracker logos, and link to PrivacyChoice tracker info pages when appropriate.
factored out a bunch of gloop into a new function, showDomainInfo()
new coloring scheme: if the domain is a known tracker, it's red, otherwise it's gray.
fixed a bug whereby multiple svg title elements were being inserted on every update
Added trackers.json from the XPI for TrackerBlock 2.0.1. It was located in chrome/content/adnetworks.
changed version to 0.2
Added a pagemod that sends the collusion graph visualizer new data whenever it's updated.
removed old sample tracking info json
click to advance time/next navigation in sample data visualization.
sample data is now shown over time
simplified logic more
simplified addNode()
got rid of unused removeDomainsWithOneReferrer() function
got rid of some complex bookkeeping code
clamp max radius of nodes
new links now appear under all nodes.
node strength now changes dynamically using a cool-looking transition.
mouseover arcs now work w/ dynamically added links
checkpoint; proof-of-concept of dynamic, streaming graph manipulation. way cool.
updated package.json
added favicon link rel
added new favicon
changed base url to point to secure.toolness.com.
added html collusion visualizer
converted log to be structured by domain -> referrer -> types
now logging json
use only http-on-examine-response observer, and log information about content type, status code, request method.
removed getWindowFromChannel
Origination.

Bookmarklet now opens collusion visualization in a new tab.

Also added bookmarklet install page.
Sidebar now lists and explains both incoming and outgoing links from the hovered node.
Removed unwanted .DS_Store files that came with the merge from AM's pull request
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/toolness/collusion

Merge pull request #51 from aleatora/master

bug #15 - added shutterclick sound when cookies are set
shutterclick - bug #15
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/toolness/collusion
Trying to make the sidebar show sites that this site reports data to as well as sites that this site gets data from.

Merge pull request #50 from aostiles/master

An Attempt at Persistence
Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/toolness/collusion
aostiles - started to get persistence working

Added an experimental Collusion bookmarklet, which simply goes through all the scripts, stylesheets, images, etc. in a page and sees where they link to. A button at the bottom-left of the page allows a user to export the graph as JSON.

In the future, we could have this bookmarklet visualize the graph in the page, and even do some local storage in the front-end that allows it to keep track of a persistent graph across visits to different sites that the bookmarklet is activated on.

Merge pull request #49 from mdhagan/master

add info about halo into sidebar description
Add in explanation of halo to sidebar
Trivial whitespace change to test commit hook.
Removed unused css class and some lines of debugging output
Issue 43: Used SVG gradient to put a cool glow behind visited nodes, instead of outlining them blue.
Issue 43 - now when hovering over a node, the nodes connected either direction (data from this node or data to this node) are all highlighted.
Resolved merge conflict
A somewhat messy attempt to fix #48, "Graph gets all flickery when you're dragging a node".
Issue 43: Connecting lines not related to the highlighted subgraph now disappear completely on mouseover. Reduced opacity to 15% for nodes not in the hilighted subgraph.
Issue 43 - replaced tooltip text with an SVG round-rectangle text container that pops out from under the node on mouse-over.
Made the graph start out near the center of the screen instead of crawling on from the edge.
Added a 'hide UI' button to index.html - useful for making screenshots, slideshows, and videos
added CSS transitions for opacity and stroke-opacity to nodes and the links between them. Hovering over nodes now results in gentler transitions.
use a CSS class, unrelated-domain, to mark unrelated domains, instead of directly setting their opacity in code.
Issue 20 - now only add a link to the graph if the cookie requested by the header was actually set. This makes the graph accurately represent the user's cookie-blocking settings.
Issue 43 - now hovering over a node will hilight that node and its immediate connections by making everything else fade out.
Issue 43 - changed colors to look more like Barry's mockup
Issue 36 fixed - incorrect favicons were because I reparented the nodes in the mouseover handler, confusing d3's mapping between elements and data. Removed that effect.
Issue 47 - should have included this paren in last commit
Issue 47 - Fixed demo mode (had to update sample-tracking-info.json to use the new format as well as change some of the logic in demo.js to parse the new format.)
Issue 46 fixed - got rid of Mozilla-specific JS syntax that was breaking on Safari
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/toolness/collusion
added a --server-only option to develop.py.
Tweaked graph layout parameters to make nodes spread out more
Made circles colored on the outside and white on the inside to match Barry's mockup
Removed debugging statements that should not have been included in previous commit, sorry
Issue 26 - extension now notes which domains you actually visit; graphrunner.js uses this info to turn those nodes blue.
adding a warning if addon sdk doesn't seem to be activated.
Added develop.py, which starts up the localhost webserver and runs cfx run simultaneously. Added a quick-start section to the README which guides new developers to use it.

Moved all website-specific files into a website directory, so that they're not confused with files that are only relevant to the addon. Symlinking shared files between the website and addon, and forcing links to be copied/collapsed on deployment.
Undid changes from 5fe9f0749e27d1df67dc02aeee855f92e5e02358 because combined with the changes from 2a6c92f11edc353dc21eef4cf5f97d3b63f6dc86 they look crummy.

Merge branch 'refactorings'

Conflicts:
	data/graphrunner.js
Fixed merge conflict
Factored out all application-specific code in graphrunner.js and moved it into index.html. Soon, graphrunner.js will be able to be embedded in any page that needs to display a collusion graph.
Added collusion-addon.js, which encapsulates the addon's functionality in web content, as well as detecting whether the addon is installed in web content.
Converted jQuery.fn.setDomainLink() into a private function, as we don't want to pollute the jQuery namespace with such private things.
Separated out demo code into its own file, demo.js.
Dependencies are now explicitly passed into GraphRunner via its constructor function.
Enclosed graphrunner.js into its own scope with a single export, GraphRunner.init().

got rid of the dumb page=big thing. now you can pass in graph_url=(some url) and the exported graph will be displayed in the window. You can always pass an invalid URL and then drag-and-drop instead of doing the page=big thing now. Still not an ideal solution, but simpler than page=big.
Added anonymizer for exported graphs.
nodes can be dragged properly again (they don't randomly flicker between their dragged position and the top-left of the screen).
the querystring param 'page=big' can now be used to force the graph's area to be big in demo mode.

dragging a JSON graph export into the page during demo mode will load the graph. among other things, this means we can browse graphs in non-Firefox browsers. unfortunately, right now the graph is still constrained to 640x480, which should be fixed, since it's horrible for browsing massive graphs.
link hovering has a yellow background again, but the text is black to improve contrast.
changed styling of reset/export graph buttons.
color changes to cope with the new dark background.
Added test suite with one very trivial smoke test.
HTML page for XPI download now includes information on commit and deployment name.
added link to XPI in deployment-info section.
The front-end now reads deployment.json and displays some of its information. It also points XPI download links to the right places.
added deployment.json to .gitignore
Added git commit information to generated deployment.json.
generate data/deployment.json instead of frontend-url file. Also added 'configure' fabric task.
upgrade to 0.15.2 to test git push hook again.
Trivial version change to 0.15.1 to test out git push hook.

load frontend url from data/frontend-url if it exists, otherwise default to collusion.toolness.org. The deploy_xpi target now automatically creates data/frontend-url and sets it to an appropriate value, deleting it when it's done building the xpi.
Merge branch 'stable'
renamed fabfile deploy task to deploy_frontend and made a new deploy target which just runs deploy_frontend and deploy_xpi.
made collusion.toolness.org and dev-collusion.toolness.org permanently trusted URLs, so the collusion.urls pref doesn't need to contain them.
added http://dev-collusion.toolness.org to default list of trusted front-end URLs.
Merge branch 'stable'
incremented version to 0.15, solely to represent latest version of addon sdk used in build.
added 'deploy_xpi' target to fabfile, based on some other python code I had laying around.
Added .gitignore.
Merge branch 'stable'
Added fabfile.py.
Changed title of collusion.urls preference.
Undo previous two commits, and store the collusion.urls pref using the new simple-prefs module.
added collusion.urls.default-value to .gitignore.
Allow the default base url list to be specified by a file in data/collusion.urls.default-value.
Added brackets to bare conditional
Put drag handler on g element instead of favicon; this fixes weird drag behavior.
Changed bg colors to make text divs more readable on dark background
the startTime of an imported graph is now given an appropriate value, so that new sites visited are chronologically after the sites visited in the imported graph.
exported graphs can now be re-imported by dragging the graph file onto the collusion web page. not very discoverable, but at least it works for now.
added an 'export graph' button, which just opens a new window with JSON in it for now.
Removed unneeded 'var'
Factored CSS, JS out of index.html into separate files
Made background dark/links light
Made nodes draggable again
Separated index.html into separate html, css, and js files.
Graph nodes now pop to front when mouse-overed
Hovering over a node now makes it appear larger and makes the links attached to it turn solid black.
Added favicons to nodes in the site graph
had weird problems w/ updating my addon-sdk, updated version # to reflect real addon-sdk upgrade.
changed version to 0.12 - only difference is that the XPI is now created with the add-on sdk 1.1.
Changed version to 0.11.
